data.title: Best Ramen Shop in Lawrence
data.text: Visiting my son in Lawrence, Kansas, home of Kansas State University. Decided to let him pick the place for dinner and he went with ramen noodles. At one time I hoped to forget about living on ramen noodles in college but his place was very good. I recommend any one of the featured ramen dishes coupled with an appetizer. The college crowd in Lawrence is fun to watch but this place can be a tight fit and is not wheel chair friendly.

data.title: European Style Coffeeshop
data.text: Great small little coffeeshop in downtown Lawrence with an excellent espresso repertoire. Cappuccinos are great, and I miss the 2-for-1 Tuesdays they used to have. Otherwise, it is still well priced. Some unique drinks like the Grasshopper. Great location for a downtown stroll. I've spent many an hour working and enjoying the large windows and watching locals walk by. Typically they have at least three varieties for drip coffee, which is great. The beans are good (my favorite was the Colombian), and the atmosphere is classy with marble and elegant wood features. Not a lot of room for a large group, but there are 1-2 large tables.

data.title: Best local coffee
data.text: This is my favorite local place to get coffee in Lawrence.  I highly recommend the iced grasshopper--it is delicious.  Drinks here are reasonably priced, and there are several sitting areas so you can just pop in for a quick drink, or stay a while.  They have wifi too, so it's a good place to work.   Service can be give or take...the baristas aren't always the friendliest, but the drinks are always good and that's more important to me than a smiley barista.

data.title: Morning cappuccino with almond milk
data.text:
I start my day with having a small single shot cappuccino with unsweetened almond milk. I like it. It makes me feel ready for work. I am from Europe so I take all my European visitors for coffee there. They like the place as much as I do.
Staff is so friendly there!

data.title: Best Coffee in the Area!!!!
data.text: Forget Starbucks and come visit La Prima Tazza.  They have wonderful espressos and very friendly and efficient service.  Been coming here for years and they are every bit as good as they were from the first visit.  They have rearranged the tables so it has a much better flow to the room.  Can get really busy when the college students are there surfing the web as they have good wi-fi available.  But they seem to have fixed that problem during peak hours as they now have more of a limit on how long students can camp out there.  An old-world ambiance.  They have cookies and muffins most days but this is more of just a coffee house rather than a restaurant.

data.title: Great Coffee
data.text: Try the Iced or hot grass hopper, they are wonderful! The coffee is great, the iced tea is outstanding as well. The baristas are always nice and patient as well.

data.title: A local coffee shop
data.text: PT as the locals call it serves up wonderful coffee drinks and brewed teas. My favorite is the mocha Florentine. There is a group of regulars who are there every morning and you'll often see people working on their laptops. But close the computer and just visit with your neighbors.

data.title: Coffee Attire
data.text: I can't speak to the coffee per se but my friend thinks it's great! Atmosphere is coffee shoppy. Please have the barista wear an appropriate shirt. Also I suggest getting logo'd cups. Styro is not only bad for the environment it looks cheap.

data.title: You can't beat this coffee! Move over Starbucks
data.text: Fabulous espressos and the baristas know what they're doing!  A laid back atmosphere and when it's not too busy a great place to surf the web, too.  But if it's busy, good luck as students download HUGE documents and jam up the whole system.

data.title: Nice place for a cup
data.text: They have wi-fi, great coffee and fairly limited space. It's close to Free State and Liberty Hall, which are likely draws if you're visiting Lawrence for the first time. Parking can be a little tricky... if you don't find street parking, consider the lot on the southeast corner of Mass and 6th.

data.title: Great coffee
data.text:
Really good double espresso!!
Service is great and the place is beautiful.
Don't miss it if you appreciate good coffee.

data.title: great little coffee joint
data.text: If you go on Sunday morning you can hang out with the locals and sip your coffee and chat. its a great local establishment. Well traveled spot and an addition to morning life in Lawrence.

data.title: Local coffee house downtown
data.text: This is a small local coffee house with all of the usual coffee drinks and a very limited selection of pastries.  The decor is eclectic, and the clientele ranges from college students to downtown employees to "townies" who just like to hang out and read or work on a computer.  Prices are reasonable, staff are pleasant, and best of all - it is NOT a cookier cutter chain shop!

data.title: Coffee in downtown Lawrence with Old World style
data.text: In a town full of coffee shops, La Prima Tazza stands out for its relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Located near Liberty Hall, on Mass. St.,  the shop's décor is no nonsense, coffee shop with wood and plaster. Its coffee is solid, well-brewed, and made without frivolity. The baked goods are not too impressive, and sometimes the service is slow; the baristas can be a bit gruff. But we go there to drink coffee, read the paper, and meet with friends. Awesome spot in Lawrence.

data.title: My teenager lives there. Friendly European style place.
data.text: She says the coffee and tea are better and cheaper than anywhere else. They have a friendly European style policy - you can sit forever, but you are supposed to be considerate enough to move on if the tables fill up. The place is always populated. The coffee beans and drinks are fine. They do not have much in the way of food - some simple baked goods. It is a friendly, casual, quiet, small place. You might have to wait in line for your coffee. There is not outdoor seating except for a bench. This is on the main street in Lawrence next to the old movie theater.

data.title: Good late night coffee and study place.
data.text: Good late night coffee and study place.
